channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I’m 51, married and pay $200 a month for a $1.5 million term life insurance policy. When should I cancel it?
item.description: “I am five years from financial independence.”

item.title: What’s the true price of Thanksgiving? Trump says groceries are getting cheaper, but many Americans are still concerned about costs.
item.description: A new survey finds Americans expect to spend $175 on food and as much as $952 overall on this Thanksgiving, including turkey, travel and decor

item.title: ‘I’m a big fan of DIY investing’: I’m 64 and moving to the U.S. I have $2.6 million, but no Social Security. Will I be OK?
item.description: “Advisers do well in bull markets and poorly in bear markets, while I generally do better during downturns than the S&P 500.”

item.title: I have a $10K expense. Do I withdraw money from my investments or my high-yield savings account?
item.description: “It will likely take me about a year to replace the $10,000.”

item.title: I’m in my 50s and divorced with a $1.7 million home. I fell in love with an old school friend. Does it make financial sense to marry?
item.description: “I have a $500,000 Roth IRA, a portfolio account of $500,000 and $300,000 in 529 plans.”

item.title: Dan Loeb's Third Point leans back into tech, doubling Microsoft bet and adding Nvidia, Amazon
item.description: The hedge fund added to a handful of megacap tech names in the third quarter, more than doubling its stake in Microsoft.
